{"step_by_step_thinking": "All of the drugs listed are types of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), which are commonly used to treat depression and anxiety disorders. Abruptly stopping any SSRI can lead to withdrawal symptoms, which are often referred to as SSRI discontinuation syndrome. However, Fluoxetine has a longer half-life compared to other SSRIs, which means it stays in the body for a longer period of time. This can help to reduce the risk of withdrawal symptoms when the medication is stopped.", "answer_choice": "B. Fluoxetine"}
